speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the severity of the flank pain - is it sharp, dull, or does it come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: It's more of a dull ache, to be honest, and it's been persistent, not really going away, even when I'm resting or taking it easy.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when the pain started? Was it immediately after the antibiotic treatment, or did it develop over time, perhaps after you finished the treatment?

speaker: Patient
text: It started a few weeks after I finished the antibiotic treatment, actually. It's been about 6 weeks now, and the pain has been there pretty much every day.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the fever - is it intermittent or constant, and what's the highest temperature you've experienced so far? Also, have you noticed any changes in your urine output or the color of your urine since the pain started?

speaker: Patient
text: The fever is constant, to be honest, it's just a steady hum of a temperature that I've gotten used to. I've been checking my thermometer every morning, and it's usually around 100.5 to 101 degrees. As for the urine, I haven't noticed any changes in color, but I have noticed that I'm not urinating as frequently as I used to.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your kidney function before the pain started? Have you ever had any issues with your kidneys or urinary tract before? Also, REQUEST TEST: Blood_Urine_Test

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: - Urea: 10-20 mmol/L (Normal Readings) - Creatinine: 60-120 μmol/L (Normal Readings) - Leukocyturia: 0-2 WBCs/HPF (Normal Readings) - Protein: 0-100 mg/dL (Normal Readings) - Blood: 0-10 RBCs/HPF (Normal Readings) - pH: 5.5-8.0 (Normal Readings) - Specific_Gravity: 1.010-1.030 (Normal Readings)

speaker: Doctor
text: It seems the blood test results are all within normal ranges, which is a bit reassuring. Can you tell me more about your overall energy level - how would you describe it? Are you feeling weak, tired, or just generally unwell?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I'm feeling extremely tired all the time. I just can't seem to muster up the energy to do anything, even simple tasks like taking a shower or cooking a meal. It's like I'm running on empty all the time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the activities that you're finding difficult to complete due to fatigue? Are you having trouble sleeping at night, or is it more of a daytime fatigue? Also, have you experienced any nausea or vomiting, especially after meals or at night?

speaker: Patient
text: It's mostly the daytime fatigue that's getting to me, to be honest. I used to be able to get up and go about my day without too much trouble, but lately, just getting out of bed and making it to the kitchen feels like a huge accomplishment. I'm also having trouble keeping my mind sharp, which is unusual for me since I've always been a pretty active person.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your mental clarity - do you find yourself getting confused or disoriented easily, or is it more of a general feeling of being "off" mentally? Also, REQUEST TEST: Complete_Blood_Count
